revisionDesc.change: Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - All looks good. The lack of BL 7.88 in the app. crit. is indeed curious...

Submit - Some minor correctios and clarifications. Sigma of l. 2: τ̣[ῆ]ς is dotted in the edition. In l. 4, the current entry of BL 1.297 is incorrect: the ed. pr. does not have β]εβαίαν but β]εβαιοῦσαν (no accents in P.Lond. 3). I completed the chain of published BL entries for l. 8: [Α]ὐρηλία Ἀμαλεὲτ (the ed. pr. does not set accents, and I suggest giving none for its original reading Ἀμαλεστ) and added another one at the end of l. 4. Curious is the BL entry of l. 2: in the situation before my modification, the correction by BL 7.88 is introduced in the text and the asterisk is there but the reference is not visible (at least on my computer) in the app. crit., while the entries for the other lines *are* visible; I can, however, find this lost entry from the app. crit. *when looking for the original reading (ἐνδόξου καὶ λαμπροτάτου) in a PN search* (!) ; it is displayed in the preview of the search mask but it is not visible on the page of P.Lond. 3.1008. I expanded the entry to be clearer on the various stages of restoration of that line.
